job_data.title: Product Manager, Physical Retail Sales & Service
job_data.description:
**Who We Are \[Physical Retail Sales \& Service]**



Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. Our product team plays a crucial role in making this vision a reality for millions of people around the world. Partnering with engineering, UX design, analytics, and business partners across Wayfair, our product team ensures that we’re building technology that solves important customer problems in elegant, scalable, measurable ways. We have a modern tech stack including sophisticated capabilities around AI, data science, multivariate testing, and personalization. We’re a highly collaborative, supportive team that values learning, psychological safety, and intentional career development.



The Physical Retail Sales \& Service team is responsible for the technology experience that powers our brick\-and\-mortar stores. The Product Manager in this role will unify two core areas of focus: (1\) enabling customer self\-service through tools like digital displays, e\-labels, and our in\-store mobile app, and (2\) equipping store associates with a bespoke point of sale system that integrates seamlessly with our specialty, omni\-channel sales and service tools.



This role will own initiatives spanning the end\-to\-end in\-store experience – from “See in Store” discovery on our e\-commerce platform, to complex assisted purchases like renovation projects, to post\-sale support like returns. You’ll shape how customers shop independently and how associates assist with confidence.


**What You’ll Do**


* Define and deliver experiences that help customers explore, discover, and transact independently in physical retail environments.
* Drive integration and optimization of tools for store associates, including selling tools, POS, and customer service interactions.
* Own cross\-domain initiatives spanning in\-store and online journeys to simplify complex purchases and promote expert\-supported sales.
* Partner with design, engineering, analytics, and retail stakeholders to build scalable, measurable solutions that improve conversion, satisfaction, and operational efficiency.
* Manage cross\-functional projects from discovery through delivery, ensuring tight alignment with physical retail strategy.
* Translate complex workflows into clear product requirements and cross\-domain contracts.
* Champion associate and customer needs while balancing business goals and technical constraints.
* Communicate product vision and progress to stakeholders across the company, including senior leadership.


**What You’ll Need**


* 4\+ years building software products at scale from concept to launch and beyond.
* Experience with consumer\-facing or retail associate tools preferred.
* Strong technical background and ability to break down complex problems into incremental value delivery.
* Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills across technical and non\-technical audiences.
* Comfort with data and a passion for using it to drive decision\-making; SQL a plus.
* Understanding of how tools and platforms integrate in omni\-channel retail settings.
* A bias for action and customer\-focused innovation mindset.

**About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.



No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk\-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well\-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic.



Your personal data is processed in accordance with our Candidate Privacy Notice (https://www.wayfair.com/careers/privacy). If you have any questions or wish to exercise your rights under applicable privacy and data protection laws, please contact us at dataprotectionofficer@wayfair.com.
job_data.company_description: Wayfair is the destination for all things home: helping everyone, anywhere create their feeling of home.

job_data.title: Senior Product Manager, Talent Solutions
job_data.description:
***An Important Note about Wayfair's In\-Office Policy and Salary:***



Please note that this is a hybrid role based in Boston, MA, and will require you to work in the office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays.

  



The salary range for this position is $161,000 \- $172,500 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job\-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units will also be provided as part of the compensation package.

  


**Who We Are:**



At Wayfair, we’re transforming how people shop for their homes—and that same spirit of innovation drives how we scale our global workforce. The Talent Technology team sits at the intersection of People, Process, and Product, delivering solutions that power every stage of the employee journey.

  



As a Senior Product Manager, Talent Technology, you will lead end\-to\-end initiatives that redefine how employees experience support—from process design to systems implementation. You’ll own high\-impact projects that streamline operations, drive AI\-powered self\-service, and reduce manual intervention across the HR ecosystem. This role requires strong systems thinking, comfort with technical complexity, and the ability to align diverse stakeholders around common priorities. You’ll be responsible for evaluating and implementing third\-party solutions, redesigning business processes, and improving interoperability across platforms like Workday, Alight, Avature, Verint, and other HR technologies.

  


**What You’ll Do:**


* Drive the strategy and execution of AI\-enabled self\-service capabilities that reduce friction and empower employees
* Lead vendor evaluations and manage full lifecycle implementation of new tools, ensuring alignment with architectural and business goals
* Redesign and streamline process flows across core HR areas (e.g., recruiting, onboarding, time tracking, payroll, benefits)
* Uncover and address manual processes by leveraging Workday capabilities and other system features
* Lead discovery and reconfiguration efforts within Workday to optimize core workflows and drive measurable efficiencies
* Define and maintain a product roadmap that balances speed, scale, and long\-term impact
* Drive organization\-wide change management strategies, plan for successful adoption, and manage the learning curve across diverse stakeholder groups
* Collaborate with cross\-functional teams (Engineering, Legal, HR, Compliance) to align on technical feasibility, requirements, and compliance needs
* Translate complex business needs into clear product features, user flows, and outcomes
* Leverage data, experimentation, and feedback to drive continuous improvement
* Act as the connective tissue across stakeholder groups, ensuring shared understanding, accountability, and adoption

  


**What You’ll Need**


* 6–10 years of experience in product management or HR technology in a complex, matrixed environment
* Proven ability to lead end\-to\-end product delivery—from vendor selection through implementation and change adoption
* Strong systems thinking with experience mapping and redesigning workflows for efficiency
* Demonstrated success enabling automation, AI/ML, or self\-service tools within enterprise ecosystems
* Expertise managing and integrating core HR systems like Workday, Avature, Verint, and related tools
* Excellent communication, stakeholder management, and prioritization skills
* Experience navigating ambiguity, balancing tradeoffs, and aligning business and technical teams

  


**Why You’ll Love Wayfair:**


* Time Off:
* + Paid Holidays
	+ Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Health \& Wellness:
* + Full Health Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, HSA/FSA)
	+ Life Insurance
	+ DIsability Protection (Short Term \& Long Term DIsability)
	+ Global Wellbeing: Gym/Fitness discounts (including US Peloton, Global ClassPass, and various regional gym memberships)
	+ Mental Health Support (Global Mental Health, Global Wayhealthy Recordings)
	+ Caregiver Services
* Financial Growth \& Security:
* + 401K Matching (Employee Matching Program)
	+ Tuition Reimbursement
	+ Financial Health Education (Knowledge of Financial Education \- KOFE)
	+ Tax Advantaged Accounts
* Family Support:
* + Family Planning Support
	+ Parental Leave
	+ Global Surrogacy \& Adoption Policy
* Professional Development \& Recognition:
* + Rewards \& Recognition
	+ Global Employee Anniversary Awards
	+ Paid Volunteer Work
* Unique Perks:
* + Employee Discount
	+ U.S. Bluebikes Membership
	+ Global Pod Outings
* Work/Life Balance:
* + Emphasizing a supportive \& flexible work environment that encourages a balance between personal and professional commitments

We are looking forward to your application!

**About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.



No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk\-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well\-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic.



Your personal data is processed in accordance with our Candidate Privacy Notice (https://www.wayfair.com/careers/privacy). If you have any questions or wish to exercise your rights under applicable privacy and data protection laws, please contact us at dataprotectionofficer@wayfair.com.

job_data.title: Machine Learning Scientist III
job_data.description:
#### **The base pay for this position is $198,000 \- $220,000 per year. The base pay offered may vary depending on location, job\-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units will be provided as part of the compensation package.**

**About this role**



We are looking for an experienced **Machine Learning Scientist III** to join our content recommendations team. In this role, you will be at the core of building and optimizing **ML\-based recommender systems** (e.g., image and content recommendations, homepage and email optimization and personalization) to enhance the customer experience at Wayfair. Your work will directly impact **how millions of customers** discover and engage with products, driving significant business value.



As part of Wayfair's **SMART (Search, Marketing, and Recommendations Technology)** team, you will collaborate with ML scientists, engineers, and product teams to **develop and deploy cutting\-edge recommendation models** that operate at scale. This role is an opportunity to **solve complex problems** related to personalization, large\-scale machine learning, latency, and scalability while leveraging **state\-of\-the\-art (SOTA) AI techniques.**


#### **What you’ll do**


* **Develop and optimize recommendation models** that power personalized experiences across Wayfair’s site, app, email, and push notifications.
* **Conduct applied research** to improve recommender systems using traditional ML techniques, deep learning and reinforcement learning.
* **Build scalable ML pipelines** for training, evaluation, and inference, ensuring models operate efficiently in production.
* **Work closely with engineering teams** to deploy models in a production environment, addressing real\-world constraints such as latency, interpretability, and scalability.
* **Analyze model performance and iterate** based on A/B test results, offline evaluation metrics, and business impact.
* **Leverage and contribute to open\-source ML frameworks** while staying up to date with cutting\-edge research in recommendation systems.
* **Drive innovation** by identifying opportunities to improve personalization strategies and developing novel algorithms that enhance customer engagement.
* **Collaborate with cross\-functional teams** including product managers, software engineers, and data scientists to align ML objectives with business goals.


**Mentor other less experienced scientists on the team**


#### **Who you are**


* **5\+ years of experience** developing and deploying machine learning models, with a focus on recommendations, ranking, or personalization.
* Strong theoretical understanding of **machine learning and deep learning** applied to large\-scale recommendation problems.
* Experience in **training, evaluating, and optimizing recommendation models** in production, leveraging techniques such as collaborative filtering, sequence modeling, representation learning and multi\-armed bandits.
* Proficiency in **Python** and experience with ML frameworks such as **TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit\-Learn.**
* Familiarity with **big data processing** (Spark, Hadoop) and ML pipeline orchestration (Airflow, Kubeflow, MLflow).
* Strong coding skills and familiarity with **building scalable ML systems in cloud environments (AWS, GCP, Azure).**
* Ability to **design experiments and analyze results** using A/B testing and statistical techniques.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to **explain complex ML concepts** to non\-technical stakeholders and drive data\-driven decisions.

#### **Nice to have**


* Experience developing **core recommendation systems** for **eCommerce, marketplaces, or streaming platforms.**
* Familiarity with **reinforcement learning or contextual bandits** for adaptive recommendation strategies.


This role offers the opportunity to work on **high\-impact ML problems at scale, shaping the future of personalization and recommendations at Wayfair.** If you're passionate about building intelligent systems that enhance customer experiences, we’d love to hear from you!

  


**Why You'll Love Wayfair:**


* Time Off:
	+ Paid Holidays
	+ Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Health \& Wellness:
	+ Full Health Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, HSA/FSA)
	+ Life Insurance
	+ Disability Protection (Short Term \& Long Term Disability)
	+ Global Wellbeing: Gym/Fitness discounts (including US Peloton, Global ClassPass, and various regional gym memberships)
	+ Mental Health Support (Global Mental Health, Global Wayhealthy Recordings)
	+ Caregiver Services
* Financial Growth \& Security:
	+ 401K Matching (Employee Matching Program)
	+ Tuition Reimbursement
	+ Financial Health Education (Knowledge of Financial Education \- KOFE)
	+ Tax Advantaged Accounts
* Family Support:
	+ Family Planning Support
	+ Parental Leave
	+ Global Surrogacy \& Adoption Policy
* Professional Development \& Recognition:
	+ Rewards \& Recognition
	+ Global Employee Anniversary Awards
	+ Paid Volunteer Work
* Unique Perks:
	+ Employee Discount
	+ U.S. Bluebikes Membership
	+ Global Pod Outings
* Work/Life Balance:
	+ Emphasizing a supportive \& flexible work environment that encourages a balance between personal and professional commitments

**Wayfair's In\-Office Policy:**



All Mountain View\-based interns, co\-ops, and corporate employees will be in office in a hybrid capacity. Employees will work in the office on designated days, Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday, and work remotely the other 2 days of the week.

  


**About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.



No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk\-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well\-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic.



Your personal data is processed in accordance with our Candidate Privacy Notice (https://www.wayfair.com/careers/privacy). If you have any questions or wish to exercise your rights under applicable privacy and data protection laws, please contact us at dataprotectionofficer@wayfair.com.

job_data.title: Product Manager, Wayfair Fulfillment & Delivery Network
job_data.description:
**Who We Are \[Wayfair Fulfillment \& Delivery Network]**



We are looking for a passionate Product Manager to join the Wayfair Fulfillment and Delivery Network (WFDN) 4Walls team. The WFDN 4Walls team is responsible for ensuring the smooth delivery of customer orders through Wayfair’s Delivery Network. This role will help enable key growth drivers and technology improvements in Wayfair’s transportation network that will further enhance Wayfair’s customer delivery experience by unlocking new service offerings while optimizing supply chain costs and improving internal transportation users’ experience. The successful candidate will be responsible for designing and implementing easy\-to\-use, relevant, and insightful customer experiences along with the underlying technical platform across geos and channels.

  


**What You’ll Do**


* Develop a deep understanding of Wayfair customers, the internal users and the key metrics, financials and business outcomes that drive Wayfair’s Supply Chain.
* Partner with Business and Operations stakeholders to prioritize and develop impactful solutions that drive key business value.
* Use Agile processes to collaborate with partnering teams (engineers, experience designers, analytics) to execute your prioritized roadmap.
* Communicate and promote the product vision and progress throughout Wayfair including senior leaders.
* Develop and monitor OKRs for key product initiatives and ensure alignment with stakeholder objectives.

  


**What You’ll Need**


* 5\+ years building online products at scale, preferably with Supply Chain domain expertise
* Demonstrated success in creating products that drive business impact.
* Customer empathy driving a focus on customer problems and solutions
* Strong analytical and data\-driven decision making skills
* Strong ability to deliver results in a fast\-paced environment while utilizing good mechanisms for planning and execution
* Sufficient technical literacy to effectively communicate with engineering. Technical degree is a plus
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills at the senior partner level.
* Positive, people\-oriented, and collaborative attitude.

  


***An Important Note about Wayfair's In\-Office Policy:***


*Please note that this is a hybrid role based in Boston, and will require you to work in the office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays.*

 **About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.



No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk\-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well\-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic.



Your personal data is processed in accordance with our Candidate Privacy Notice (https://www.wayfair.com/careers/privacy). If you have any questions or wish to exercise your rights under applicable privacy and data protection laws, please contact us at dataprotectionofficer@wayfair.com.

job_data.title: Product Manager, Driveway and Fleet Insights
job_data.description:
**Who We Are \[****Driveway and Fleet Insights****]**



Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. Our product team plays a crucial role in making this vision a reality for millions of people around the world. Partnering with engineering, UX design, analytics, and business partners across Wayfair, our product team ensures that we’re building technology that solves important customer problems in elegant, scalable, measurable ways. We have a modern tech stack including sophisticated capabilities around AI, data science, multivariate testing, and personalization. We’re a highly collaborative, supportive team that values learning, psychological safety, and intentional career development.



The Driveway and Fleet Insights team is responsible for the Wayfair Delivery Network Driveway app (Android) and visibility tool. The Product Manager in this role would work to build friction\-free driver and dispatcher applications that facilitate the movement of goods across the Wayfair global network and enable visibility into every step of the driver journey. This role and the associated products help to uncover opportunities for the surrounding Wayfair ecosystem (e.g. Routing, Customer Notification, Special instructions) in order to address gaps/defects which enhance the customer delivery experience.


**What You’ll Do**


* Areas of responsibility include solutioning in the Order Processing and Order Lifecycle Management spaces in order to support Wayfair’s growth and partner strategies in the e\-commerce space.
* Responsible for managing cross domain projects from discovery to delivery.
* Manage and create technical API data contracts to support the, defining how users should interact with the platform
* Ensure we are building a reliable, scalable, and extensible platform that supports the post order customer shopping experience
* Partner with business stakeholders to understand their businesses and co\-develop impactful solutions that drive key business value.
* Communicate and promote the product vision and progress throughout Wayfair including senior partners.


**What You’ll Need**


* 4 \+ years building software products at scale from concept to launch and beyond.
* Strong technical background with a passion for breaking down challenging problems and drive value incrementally
* Sufficient industry literacy to participate in making key choices as well as effectively communicate with technical partners such as engineering.
* Excellent analytical skills with demonstrated experience turning data into actionable insights. Some SQL experience preferred
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills at the senior leadership level, as well as with cross\-functional teams
* Deep understanding of how API\-focused products support business strategy and metrics
* Highly entrepreneurial mindset, with a bias for action \& customer\-focused innovation
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience is preferred.

  


***An Important Note about Wayfair's In\-Office Policy:***


*Please note that this is a hybrid role based in Boston, and will require you to work in the office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays.*

  


**About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.



No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk\-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well\-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic.
